peripherals

Class Peripheral

  • java.lang.Object
    • peripherals.Peripheral

  • public final class Peripheral
extends java.lang.Object
    Represent a Peripheral inside the Nexus. Custom functionality is added by means of a PeripheralDescriptor. This class should not be extended. Each Peripheral has its own threading to prevent blocking calls from tying up the main Jarvis thread.
    Author:
    Paul

    • Constructor Detail

      • Peripheral

        public Peripheral(int peripheralType,
          int peripheralID,
          java.lang.String name,
          TriggerHandler delegate)
        Initialize a new instance of a Peripheral because a new device has been added to the network.
        Parameters:
        peripheralType - This parameter determines which PeripheralDescriptor to use with this Peripheral. If peripheralType does not correspond to an actual PeripheralDescriptor, the user will be prompted to manually set a Descriptor.
        peripheralID - This parameter sets the unique ID that will be associated to this Peripheral while it is in the network. This parameter should be determined by the base class.
        name - A String that will be used to identify this Peripheral to the user. //TODO: This might be stored in a lookup table instead and not ever directly associated to the Peripheral.
        delegate - an object that implements the triggerOccurred() function.

      • Peripheral

        public Peripheral(int peripheralType,
          int peripheralID,
          java.lang.String name,
          TriggerHandler delegate,
          Network network)
        Initialize a new instance of a Peripheral because a new device has been added to the network.
        Parameters:
        peripheralType - This parameter determines which PeripheralDescriptor to use with this Peripheral. If peripheralType does not correspond to an actual PeripheralDescriptor, the user will be prompted to manually set a Descriptor.
        peripheralID - This parameter sets the unique ID that will be associated to this Peripheral while it is in the network. This parameter should be determined by the base class.
        name - A String that will be used to identify this Peripheral to the user. //TODO: This might be stored in a lookup table instead and not ever directly associated to the Peripheral.
        delegate - an object that implements the triggerOccurred() function.
        network - a Network that contains the physical peripheral represented by this Peripheral object.

      • doAction

        public void doAction(java.lang.String action,
            java.lang.String... arguments)
        Execute the action action. action runs in a separate thread where descriptor is used to provide synchronization. This means that calls to descriptor will not interleave.
        Parameters:
        action - the action to execute
        arguments - the ',' separated String arguments. Since this parameter is a varargs, it is possible to simply call

        doAction("someString")

        if you are calling an action that has no arguments.

      • getPeripheralID

        public int getPeripheralID()

      • receivePacket

        public void receivePacket(byte[] data)
        Called from a lower layer when a packet is received. Fork a thread to actually process the data and return.
        Parameters:
        data -

      • validateTrigger

        public boolean validateTrigger(java.lang.String triggerID,
                      java.lang.String... arguments)
        Ensure that a particular set of Strings is valid for a particular trigger string. If the arguments are valid, but not yet in the set of enabled triggers, they will be added.
        Parameters:
        triggerID - the ID for the particular trigger that is being checked
        arguments - the ',' separated String objects that are being checked. Since this parameter is a varargs, it is possible to simply call

        validateTrigger("someString")

        if you are checking a trigger that has no arguments.

        Returns:
        true if the combination of triggerID and arguments exists already, or was successfully added. Returns false if the combination of triggerID and arguments is not valid.

      • validateAction

        public boolean validateAction(java.lang.String actionID,
                     java.lang.String... arguments)
        Ensure that a particular set of Strings is valid for a particular action string.
        Parameters:
        actionID - the ID for the particular action that is being checked
        arguments - the ',' separated String objects that are being checked. Since this parameter is a varargs, it is possible to simply call

        validateAction("someString")

        if you are checking an action that has no arguments.

        Returns:
        true if the combination of actionID and arguments can be called. Otherwise, returns false.

      • getXML

        public java.lang.String getXML()
        Returns:
        the XML data that describes this peripheral. This is the XML that was provided by the developer.
